data.title: XRPâ€™s 100 Billion Supply Is By Design â€“ Insider Reveals Why
data.description:
A discussion has surfaced within the crypto community regarding the reasoning behind XRPâ€™s fixed supply of 100 billion tokens. For years, enthusiasts and investors have questioned why Ripple opted for such a large figure when most cryptocurrencies operate with far smaller caps. Rippleâ€™s Chief Technology Officer, David Schwartz, recently addressed the question on the social platform X, shedding light on the considerations that guided the early design of the XRP Ledger. Technical Foundations Behind XRPâ€™s 100 Billion Supply David Schwartz was one of the original architects behind XRP and the XRP Ledger in 2012, and as such, he possesses unmatched insight into the cryptocurrencyâ€™s tokenomics and the rationale that shaped its design
source: https://www.newsbtc.com/xrp-news/xrps-100-billion-supply/

data.description: According to BlockBeats, data from Coinglass reveals that the cryptocurrency market saw liquidations totaling $193 million over the past 24 hours. Of this amount, long positions accounted for $101 million, while short positions made up $92.15 million.

data.title: Solana Leads in Active Addresses Among Top Public Blockchains
data.description: According to BlockBeats On-chain Detection, recent data from Nansen reveals that Solana has the highest number of active addresses among public blockchains over the past week, totaling 15.873 million. Following Solana, Tron recorded 13.241 million active addresses, while BNB Chain had 11.779 million. Aptos and Sei also made the top five list with 7.634 million and 4.281 million active addresses, respectively. This data highlights the ongoing engagement and activity within these blockchain networks.

data.title: Central Bank of Malaysia releases three-year roadmap to pilot asset tokenization projects.
data.description: The Central Bank of Malaysia (BNM) has released a three-year roadmap to pilot asset tokenization projects within the financial system. The plan will launch several proof-of-concept (POC) and pilot projects through the Digital Asset Innovation Hub (DAIH), established earlier this year. A core component of the roadmap is the establishment of the Asset Tokenization Industry Working Group (IWG), jointly led by the central bank and the Securities Commission (SC), to drive industry exploration, knowledge sharing, and regulatory coordination. The initial pilots will focus on application scenarios with clear economic value, such as supply chain finance to expand credit access for SMEs, tokenized liquidity management to improve settlement efficiency, and compliant applications that can automate Islamic financial transactions. BNM also plans to study RM100-denominated tokenized deposits and stablecoin solutions to ensure monetary consistency and improve digital settlement efficiency, and will explore integration with wholesale central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). This project aims to modernize financial infrastructure in tandem with Asian regulators such as the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). (Cointelegraph)

data.title: Berkshire Hathaway's cash reserves reached a record $381.67 billion.
data.description: Berkshire Hathaway's cash reserves reached a record $381.67 billion, and its net investment income in the third quarter was $17.311 billion, compared to $16.161 billion in the same period last year. As of September 30, 2025, it had 1,438,223 Class A equivalent shares outstanding, marking its 12th consecutive quarter as a net seller of shares. (Jinshi)

data.title: New Hampshire's bill to relax regulations on cryptocurrency mining is stalled and has been temporarily returned for review.
data.description: The New Hampshire Senate Commerce Committee was divided on a bill to ease regulations on cryptocurrency mining, causing the bill to be temporarily suspended. Several senators stated that public feedback has increased significantly since the last discussion. The committee failed to reach a consensus in both rounds of voting, ultimately deciding 4-2 to send the bill to "midterm review" for further examination. The bill (House Bill 639) aims to prohibit local governments from imposing additional restrictions on cryptocurrency mining activities (such as electricity or noise restrictions) and prohibits state or local governments from levying special taxes on digital assets. (Cointelegraph)

data.title: New Hampshire Senate Committee Delays Cryptocurrency Mining Bill
data.description: According to Odaily, the New Hampshire Senate Commerce Committee has postponed the advancement of a bill aimed at easing regulations on cryptocurrency mining due to internal disagreements. Several senators noted a significant increase in public feedback since the last discussion. The committee failed to reach a consensus in two rounds of voting, ultimately deciding by a 4-2 vote to refer the bill for 'interim study' for further examination. The proposed legislation, House Bill 639, seeks to prohibit local governments from imposing additional restrictions on crypto mining activities, such as electricity or noise limits, and to prevent state or local governments from levying special taxes on digital assets.
